info.title: PicPay - E-commerce Public API
info.description:
# Introduction

The PicPay APIs were developed based on REST technology, following the current market
technical standards. All URLs are user-friendly and resource-oriented, using HTTP protocol
standards like authentication, verbs and return codes.

As can be seen below, the APIs have been carefully crafted so that the business terms contained within are easily understood by developers who have no prior knowledge of the system. They have been meticulously studied so that a field name in an endpoint has exactly the same meaning in other resources.


# Authentication

 All communication (receiving and sending data) uses tokens for authentication. See
 the table below for tokens and streams:

 | Header | Flow |
 | ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡· - |
 |`x-picpay-token` | E-Commerce requests for PicPay.|
 |`x-seller-token` | PicPay requests for E-Commerce (Callback).|

 *Both tokens will be provided by PicPay, after completing the store registration.*


# Test environment

 Currently PicPay does not have a homologation environment for customer integration tests. All
 validations must be carried out in production, **without charge to the developer.** 
 Payments made during testing can be immediately reversed, by the API
 or [merchant's panel](https:/ /painel-empresas.picpay.com/).


 # Support
 If you have any questions, consult our FAQ or contact the PicPay Empresas relationship center by email ** contato-empresas@picpay.com.**


 **Information:** PicPay's development team does not provide consulting services, therefore, no
 codes are analyzed in our support.

tags: Create an order for a payment
post.description:
The creation of the payment request is performed at checkout, on the payment screen. It is the last stage of the 
purchase that the consumer performs. In this process, the payment method is chosen, 
you can choose to pay with PicPay. 

After choosing to pay with PicPay, 2 forms of integration with the checkout are available to generate 
 the payment order creation request:
 
 - **Payment link:**the order generated offers a URL address, informed in the `paymentUrl` field, 
 so that the consumer is directed to the PicPay payment screen.If you choose 
 redirection, using the payment link, the consumer will return to the virtual store, 
 according to the address entered in the `returnUrl` field, as soon as the payment is completed;

 - **QRCode:** returned in the `qrcode` field, an image is generated in base64 format for use directly in 
 the merchant's system, enabling the assembly of a transparent checkout. There will be no 
 visual difference between the online store and the payment page.

The identification process of the consumer in the PicPay database is based on the information 
contained in the `buyer` field. Once located, the consumer can complete the payment from the 
push notification of the PicPay application.

The payment information is sent to the e-mail registered in the application and/or e-mail informed in the 
request, in the `email` field. it is recommended to inform all data of the consumer in the 
request.

If the ecommerce needs confirmation of the value after the authorization of the consumer, 
it is necessary to send the `autoCapture` field with the value `false`,indicating that the authorized value will only be 
temporarily reserved (late capture). See capture request below for 
details.
post.summary: Request to Create order for payment

post.description:
The partial or total payment capture is realized out under the condition that the payment request is 
created with the `autoCapture` field set to `false` and the consumer has made the payment. 
The request will be awaited to effect the charge, with the correct amount, informed in the `amount` field. 
The value can be the same or less than the authorized value.Captures with a value greater than the authorized value will be 
rejected.

The return of the request informs the updated values â€‹â€‹pertinent to the transaction, located in the
`summary` field:
- **`authorized` field:** contains the authorized value; 
- **Field `paid`:** registers the amount paid (captured).


**Information:**
- The capture request is only allowed when the transaction is authorized. In the situation where 
the capture request does not occur within 5 consecutive days, counting from the authorization, the order is canceled \automatically;

- After the successful capture, even if of partial value, it will not be possible request
new capture of the same order/transaction.
post.summary: Request to capture payment total or partial

post.description:
The cancellation of the payment request is made by the retailer in a partial or total way, even if 
the payment has already taken place, by a cancellation request.

The return of the request informs the updated values â€‹â€‹pertaining to the transaction, localized in the
ca`summary` field:
- **Field `paid`:** amount paid;
- **Field `refunded`:** value canceled.

##Cancel order that does not have a payment request
When canceling an order that does not yet have payment authorization, 
a new payment attempt is not allowed.

## Canceling an authorized payment request and awaiting capture
To orders with payment authorized and awaiting capture,it is allowed to close the request 
in advance, always for the total amount, as long as the wait is within 5 days of the 
capture request. This avoids any possibility of being charged and makes the consumer's balance available 
for new purchases.

## Cancel payment request made
If the payment has been made, the amount entered in the `amount` field will be returned to the person \ nconsumer, not being allowed to return more than the amount paid.The cancellation can be partial, 
amely, when the refund amount is lower than the available amount paid (amount paid minus amount 
cancelled). 

## Cancel partially returned payment request
Partially returned payments are still considered paid and new 
cancellations are allowed until the entire amount paid has been cancelled. It is considered total cancellation when 
the consumer receives back the entire amount paid.

## Cancel payment already received
For cancellations of transactions in which the retailer has already received the amount, 
availability of amounts in their future releases, being possible a refusal of the cancellation if 
there are no resources available for the cancellation to occur.

## Canceling a payment that has cashback
The process of canceling a payment with a cashback promotion occurs when there is
a balance available in the consumer's account. In this case, a request is made for
the cashback amount to be returned proportionally to the canceled amount.

**Information:** payment cancellation with cashback promotions depends on the completion of the purchase.

post.description:
Through the callback, the merchant's system is notified when there is a change of state 
(status) in the order.
The message is sent to the address identified when creating the order, through the field
`callbackUrl`.This way, it is possible to know when something has changed and query the order again to 
update the records.

As a security measure, updates are not communicated directly to the merchant

callbackUrl`s system.This is as a guarantee that only the retailer has access 
to the data of their orders and that they do not come to the knowledge of third parties, especially malicious people.

The merchant's system must always return a successful response (status http 200) for this call.

In case the trader's system is down, there will be another 21 callback attempts.

referenceId.description: The referenceId is the order's unique identifier code, used to inform the consumer of their ID at the time of payment. The code is also used for the shopkeeper to check the payment status, cancellation request, etc.

callbackUrl.description: Url to which PicPay returns the payment status.

returnUrl.description: Url to which the consumer will be redirected after payment.

leaveUrl.description: Url for when the customer wants to give up or when they cannot pay because the order has expired

expiresAt.description: When the payment order will expire. ISO 8601 format. Example: 2022-05-01T16:00:00-03:00 (means it will expire on 01/05/2022 at 16:00 in -03:00 time zone)

channel.description: Field for exclusive use by integrators who have more than one commercial establishment (each with its own integration key).

purchaseMode.description: Identifies whether the purchase is in person or online. If it is not sent, it assumes the default value of `online`.

notification.description: Object to choose which will be the means of notification. If not informed, standard notifications will be made.

disablePush.description: Disable notification in the PicPay application.

softDescriptor.description: Additional description that will be sent in the transaction identification for the consumer's invoice.

autoCapture.description: Flag to inform if the payment capture will be automatic or not. By default the transaction is captured automatically.

paymentUrl.description: URL where the store should redirect the consumer to complete the payment.

expiresAt.description: When the payment order will expire. ISO 8601 format. Example: 2022-05-01T16:00:00-03:00 (means it will expire on 01/05/2022 at 16:00 in -03:00 time zone)

qrcode.description: Object that contains the value of the QR Code and also the ready image of the QR Code in base64 format.

base64.description: QR Code image in base64 format (valid to display in the frontend without depending on external plugins).

amount.description: Amount to be captured from the transaction. Used for partial capture, it must always be less than or equal to the total amount of the original transaction.

referenceId.description: It is the `reference Id` of the payment request of the merchant person.

status.description:
- "created": created register

- "expired": deadline for payment expired

- "authorized": authorized and awaiting capture

- "paid" : paid (captured)

- "refunded": paid and returned

- "chargeback": paid and with chargeback

authorizationId.description: Authorization ID that the e-commerce received in the paid order notification. If the order is not paid, it is not necessary to send this parameter.

amount.description: Amount to be canceled from the transaction. Used in cases of partial cancellation, it must always be less than or equal to the total amount of the original transaction.

referenceId.description: Is the `referenceId` of the payment request.
